availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jacob H. Marquess (Trigg County, Kentucky, blacksmith, wheelwright, and mechanic.)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, blacksmith, wheelwright, and mechanic. Tennessee native. Son of William K. Marquess and Charlotte Marquess. Married to Nancy Ryan Marquess in Trigg County, Kentucky, on April 6, 1855. Father of Laura B. Marquess, Charles L. Marquess, and Cyrus N. Marquess. Blacksmith in Trigg County, Kentucky, in 1850. Wheelwright in Trigg County in 1860. Mechanic in Trigg County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 1, p. 317B-318A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz, p. 192.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, District 2, p. 64B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Trigg County, KY, June 1863, p. 32.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Trigg County Marriages, Film 000321335, p. 165.
